briefdescription.para: Assigns a simple typed value to an element node.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a simple typed value for an element. Note that this may only be done once per element. This method should only be used during creation of a new tree. Using this method to modify elements after processing has begun has undefined results.

parameterdescription.para: The element for the typed value; may not be NULL.
The typed value for the element.

briefdescription.para: Assigns a simple typed value to an element node.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a simple typed value for an element. Note that this may only be done once per element. This method should only be used during creation of a new tree. Using this method to modify elements after processing has begun has undefined results.

parameterdescription.para: The element for the typed value; may not be NULL.
The typed value for the element.
String representation of the AnyURI.

memberdef.argsstring: (Item aParent, Item aNodeName, Item aTypeName, Item aTypedValue)=0
memberdef.name: createAttributeNode

briefdescription.para: Create a new attribute node N and place it among the attributes of a given parent node.

detaileddescription.para: If no parent is given, N becomes the root (and single node) of a new XML tree.

parameterdescription.para: The parent P of the new node; may be NULL.

The fully qualified name of the new node. The nemaspace binding implied by this name will be added to the namespaces of P. If the name prefix is "xml" and the local name is "base", then the base-uri property of P will be set or updated accordingly.
The fully qualified name of the new node's type.
The typed value of the new node.

simplesect.para: The new node N created by this method

memberdef.argsstring: (Item aParent, Item aNodeName, Item aTypeName, std::vector< Item > aTypedValue)=0
memberdef.name: createAttributeNode

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the data.
the length of the data (in bytes).
If true, aData is already Base-64 encoded; if false, aData is binary data that will first be Base-64 encoded.
A stream containing the Base64 encoded data. The data is copied from aStream immediately.
bool representation of the Boolean.
char representation of the Byte.

briefdescription.para: Create a new comment node N and place it as the last child of a given parent node.

detaileddescription.para: If no parent is given, N becomes the root (and single node) of a new XML tree.

parameterdescription.para: The parent P of the new node; may be NULL.
The content of the new node.

simplesect.para: The new node N created by this method

parameterdescription.para: String representation of the Date (e.g. 2002-10-10).
short-valued representation of the year.
short-valued representation of the month.
short-valued representation of the day.

memberdef.argsstring: (short aYear, short aMonth, short aDay, short aHour, short aMinute, double aSecond, int aTimeZone)=0
memberdef.name: createDateTime

parameterdescription.para: the year.
the month [1-12].
the day [1-31].
the hour [0-23].
the minute [0-59].
the seconds and fractional seconds.
the number of seconds east of the prime meridian.

memberdef.argsstring: (short aYear, short aMonth, short aDay, short aHour, short aMinute, double aSecond)=0
memberdef.name: createDateTime

briefdescription.para: Creates a DateTime Item without setting a time zone.

parameterdescription.para: the year.
the month [1-12].
the day [1-31].
the hour [0-23].
the minute [0-59].
the seconds and fractional seconds.
String representation of the datetime value (for example, 2002-10-10T12:00:00-05:00).

short-valued representation of the month.
short-valued representation of the day.
short-valued representation of the hour.
short-valued representation of the minute.
double-valued representation of the seconds and fractional seconds.
the number of seconds east of the prime meridian.

memberdef.argsstring: (Item &aParent, Item aNodeName, Item aTypeName, bool aHasTypedValue, bool aHasEmptyValue, NsBindings aNsBindings)=0
memberdef.name: createElementNode

detaileddescription.para: Create a new element node N and place it at the end among the children of a given parent node. If no parent is given, N becomes the root (and single node) of a new XML tree.

parameterdescription.para: The parent P of the new node; may be NULL.
The fully qualified name of the new node.
The fully qualified name of the new node's type. Not allowed to be NULL, use xsd:untyped instead.
Whether the node has a typed value or not (element nodes with complex type and element-only content do not have typed value).
True if the typed value of the node is the empty sequence. This is the case if the element has a complex type with empty content.
A set of namespace bindings. The namespaces property of N will be the union of this set and the namespaces property of P.

simplesect.para: The new node N created by this method

parameterdescription.para: string representation of the float.

short representation of the month.
short representation of the day.

short representation of the gYear.
String representation of the gYearMonth.
short representation of the year.
short representation of the month.
pointer to the data.
size of the data in bytes.
if true, the aData is already HexBinary encoded.
int representation of the Int.
unsigned long representation of the Integer.
String representation of the Integer.

briefdescription.para: Create a JSON Array containing the specified items.

parameterdescription.para: A std::vector<Item> containing Items which may be stored in a JSON Array (namely JSON Arrays, JSON Objects, JSON nulls, valid JSON numeric types, or xs:strings).

parameterdescription.para: A vector containing the name and value of each pair.

long long representation of the NCName.

briefdescription.para: Create a new Processing Instruction node N and place it among the children of a given parent node.

The Target of the new node.
The Content of the new node.
The Base URI of the new node, may be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: unsigned long representation of the positiveInteger.

memberdef.name: createStreamableBase64Binary

briefdescription.para: Creates a streamable Base64Binary Item see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#base64Binary].

parameterdescription.para: An istream from where to read the binary's content.
A function pointer which is invoked once the StreamableBase64Binary is destroyed. Normally this function will delete the std::istream object passed to it.
is the given stream seekable
is the contents of the given stream already base64 encoded

memberdef.argsstring: (std::istream &stream, StreamReleaser streamReleaser, char const *uri, bool seekable=false, bool encoded=false)=0
memberdef.name: createStreamableBase64Binary

briefdescription.para: Creates a streamable Base64Binary Item see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#base64Binary].

parameterdescription.para: An istream from where to read the binary's content.
A function pointer which is invoked once the StreamableBase64Binary is destroyed. Normally this function will delete the std::istream object passed to it.
The URI is intended to be used to note the origination URI (e.g., file) that data is coming from.
is the given stream seekable
is the contents of the given stream already base64 encoded

briefdescription.para: Creates a streamable String Item see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#string].

parameterdescription.para: An istream from where to read the string's content.
A function pointer which is invoked once the StreamableStringItem is destroyed. Normally this function will delete the std::istream object passed to it.

parameterdescription.para: An istream from where to read the string's content.
A function pointer which is invoked once the StreamableStringItem is destroyed. Normally this function will delete the std::istream object passed to it.
The URI is intended to be used to note the origination URI (e.g., file) that data is coming from.
String representation of the String Item.

The content of the new node.

briefdescription.para: Create an atomic item having a user-defined atomic type.

parameterdescription.para: String lexical representation of the duration.

detaileddescription.para: An instance of this class can be obtained by calling getItemFactory on the Zorba object.
Each createXXX function of this class creates an Item of an XML Schema item. If an isNull() call on an Item created by one of these functions returns true the Item could not be created.
